text: [Music]
the lazy girl and the diligent girl
there was a house in a faraway village a
house were lived a husband and a wife
both of them had one daughter each from
their previous marriage the wife loved
her daughter a lot
she gave her new clothes to wear and
never asked her to do any work
her daughter thus became very lazy she
would sit around all day doing nothing
but admiring herself on the other hand
the wife treated her stepdaughter very
poorly why are you sitting here get up
and clean the house but mother I clean
the house just this morning don't argue
with me just do as I say
the wine maker do all the work and yet
the girl never complained she would do
the same work over and over again and
never get tired
her father watched it all his heart
ached for his daughter but it could not
do anything overtime he too weak and
stayed unwell my sweet daughter I am so
sorry I can't give you anything no
father don't be sorry you loved and
cared for me all my life it's my turn
now to take care of you I will work and
earn a lot of money this is a difficult
time for us it will be over soon the
wife was quietly listening to all of
this why didn't I think of it I should
send her out and make her work with a
wealthy family I will send her away to
earn money and whatever she earns will
be mine me and my daughter will then
have the life I always wanted you are
right your father stays ill allots you
know and then there are other expenses
why don't you go out and work with a
wealthy family you could be a good
servant how dare you why don't you send
your daughter instead oh I would but she
no but she is always worried about her
pretty hands and her tiny feet she will
lose her beauty if she works besides
your daughter isn't that beautiful
anyway letting her off to do work won't
do any harm
it's decided then tomorrow morning you
will leave to look for work with a
wealthy family Oh what does she know
about beauty you don't have to work my
child no father I want to work nothing
comes out of neglecting our duties don't
worry you have taught me well I know one
day my efforts will be rewarded next
morning the girl was ready to leave she
would look for work with a wealthy
family
her stepmother did not give any food or
water for the journey but the girl
didn't mind take good care of yourself
my child and remember never say no to
anyone asking for help and be diligent
whatever you do do it with all your
heart yes I will remember that father
and the daughter left
she walked from Hill to Hill but she
found nothing she walked for days but
didn't see anybody and yet she didn't
lose hope she remembered what her father
had said never say no to anyone asking
for help and be diligent whatever you do
do it with all your heart right now I
have to focus on finding work that's
what I have to do and I will do it with
all my heart no matter how long it takes
I will not give up
a little ahead she came across a talking
tree
it was completely dried up hello girl
you seem to be going somewhere will you
help me in getting rid of my dry
branches I will do you a good deed in
return oh of course
the girl then climbed up and broke all
the dry branches with her hands didn't
stop till the tree was completely clean
of dried twigs and ready to grow new
leaves and fruits the tree thanked her
and the girl walked ahead a little
further she founded Dying vine just
beside the vine was a strange-looking
Spade the vine spoke to the girl hello
will you plow near my roots I will do
you a good deed in return the girl took
the Spade and began to plow she plowed
and plowed so her pump restored Oh hands
must hurt that's all right they will
heal you were in need and I had to help
you the vine thanked her and the girl
walked ahead a little further she came
across a broken oven and it called out
for her little girl will you clean me
and make me tidy I will do you a good
deed in return the girls saw that the
oven had a lot of cracks she thought for
a while she then brought some mud and
mixed it with her feet she then used
that mud to cover all the cracks the
oven was now as new as ever thank you
but your hands and feet got dirty that's
all right I can clean them with some
water you were in need and I have to
help
the girl had walked ahead a little
further she came across a broken well
and it spoke to her will you take out
the stale water and make me tidy I will
do you a quick tea didn't return the
girl throughout all this stale water
drop the well clean your clothes that's
all right I can clean them you were in
need and I had to help you the well
thanked her and the girl walked ahead a
little further she heard a cute little
voice it was a dog
the dog was muddy and had long hair will
you trim my hair and give me a bath at
the river I will do you a good deed in
return and the girl did the same the dog
now look happy and healthy she thanked
the girl the girl washed herself at the
river and walked ahead soon it grew dark
she came across a house there lived
seven fairies um sorry to disturb you
but it's dark outside can I stay here
for the night bear are you going
I'm looking for some work is that so why
don't you work here there are seven
rooms you will have to clean all the six
rooms every day but remember never enter
the seventh
room do you agree oh I am so grateful
thank you I will do as you say and so
the girl did she woke up everyday and
cleaned all the six rooms she never
looked at the seventh room a year passed
and the girl had earned enough money she
wished to return to her ailing father
before you leave
tell us why weren't you curious about
the seventh room my father taught me to
always follow my Duty for as long as I
worked here my duty was to obey you we
are pleased with your honesty child your
diligence has impressed us come with me
it's time for your reward the fairies
took the girl to the seventh room their
inside were heaps of gold and silver
coins go and roll over those coins
whatever six to you is yours the girl
did it she rolled over in the heap of
gold coins event in the eat of silver
coins
she's Sean like a star as all the coins
stuck to her she waved goodbye to the
fairies and left on her way back she
felt a dog she had bathed the dog now
had long pearls instead of hair come
girl you helps me when I was in need
come and take as many pearls as you want
the girl wrapped the string of pearls
around her hands legs and neck she
thanked the dog and walked away a little
further
she found the well she had cleaned you
helped me when I was in
need come drink water and coach your
thirst there many jugs kept near the
well for travelers the girl took a jug
filled it with water and drank to her
heart's content she thanked the well and
walked away a little further
she found the oven she had mended come
girl
you helped me what I was in need come
eat this fresh bread and cake so the
girl ate as much as she wanted and
carried some for her father she then
thanked the oven and walked away a
little further
she found the vine she had ploughed come
girl you helped me when I was in need
come drink this fresh wine and so the
girl drank as much as she wanted and
took some for her father she thanked the
vine and walked away a little further
she found the tree she had helped the
tree was green as ever and for fresh
pears table girl you helped me when I
was in need
comedy these fresh pears
and so the girls eat as much as you
wanted and pluck some for her father she
thanked the tree and walked away as she
returned home she was happy to see her
father he wasn't ill anymore and was
waiting for her at the door she ran to
him and hugged him tight when the mother
came she was shocked to see the husband
healthy and the daughter wealthy she was
covered from head to toe in gold and
silver and much more ignoring the mother
the father and his daughter walked
inside the stepmother realized that her
husband will not let her have anything
she immediately called out to her
daughter and asked her to go look for
work in a wealthy family listen now you
you have to learn more than her I got
faith in you
she got pearls you will get me rubies
their daughter wave goodbye and began to
walk she hadn't walked long when she
came across a tree which was completely
dried up the tree asked her to help get
rid of its dry branches in return of a
good deed are you serious I will not
dirty my clean hands on my pretty fit
for your dried branches no matter what
and she walked ahead a little further
she came across a dying light which
asked her to plow near his roots in
return of a good deed under this burning
Sun I will not dirty my clean hands and
my pretty feet for your dying Ruth
no matter what and she walked ahead a
little further she came across a broken
oven which asked her to mend it in
return of a good deed I will not dirty
my clean hands on my pretty feet no
matter what
a little further she came across a well
which asked her to clean her in return
for a good deed you are a well of water
clean yourself
I will not dirty my pretty hands on my
pretty feet no matter what a little
further she came across a dog who asked
her to bathe her in return of a good
deed but the girl ran away screaming
jewel dunderheads and her pretty feet no
matter what a little further she came to
a house and asked if she could stay the
night it was the house of the seven
fairies just like before the fairies
offered her to stay there for a year and
clean all the six rooms that remember do
not enter the seventh room the girl
agreed every day she would wake up and
clean all the six rooms but shortly
curiosity got better of her and she
entered the seventh room
it was dark inside and instead of gold
and silver coins there were frogs and
honey bees they stung her so bad that
she was bruised all over without waiting
for the fairies to come the girl ran
away from the house on her way back she
found the dog covered in pearls
she ran behind him to grab a few strings
but the dog was gone a little further
she found the well she had refused to
clean as she bent down to get a drink of
water the water slipped further down to
go out of her reach a little further
she found the oven she had refused to
mend there was fresh bread and cake near
it but when the girl tried to touch the
bread it burnt her hands a little
further she found the vine she had
refused to plow
she was very thirsty but the vine did
not let her have a drink a little
further she found the tree she had
refused to help it was full of green
leaves and fresh pears but as she tried
to reach the pears the tree grew taller
to go out of her reach
the girl then walked away back home her
mother was standing at the door hoping
to see gold and rubies but her daughter
returned covered in bruises with her
clothes all dirty you see now
laziness doesn't pay you anything only a
humble and honest heart will be rewarded
you have no place in this house anymore
you must leave the wife and the daughter
left the house the father and his
diligent daughter then lived happily
ever after
[Music]
